subject: Remove quotes from subshell call in tools/with_venv.sh
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-07 13:20:37.000000000', 'files': ['tools/with_venv.sh'], 'message': 'Remove quotes from subshell call in tools/with_venv.sh

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code in with_venv.sh, only to use a
better code style.

Change-Id: Ic0d613235fbfeb3c6aed93c55cbb8fd117b365c4
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove quotes from subshell call in tools/with_venv.sh

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code in with_venv.sh, only to use a
better code style.

Change-Id: Ic0d613235fbfeb3c6aed93c55cbb8fd117b365c4
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Allow user to select zone for their trove volume

In multi cinder zone environment, trove have volume-type support,
but does not have zone support.For Instance,if I have two cinder zone:dmz,dev
and two kind of volume in each zone:ssd,ceph.
If I only want to create trove volume in my dmz zone ssd volume , Now I cant't.
I have to reconfigure cinder to create a new volume type
to distinguish ssd in dmz from ssd others, it's very uncomfortable.

Change-Id: I4d9aeaca1cecbe5e6d4ce31eaf8802c65596e581
Closes-Bug: #1482162

commit_message:
Add support for Microsoft SQL Server datastore in Trove

Add Microsoft SQL Server datastore for Trove in addition to the
existing datastores currently supported.

The guestagent will run on Windows and include functions
like launch, terminate, resize instance and more advanced features,
like backup, restore, clustering and replication.

Blueprint: mssql-server-db-support

Change-Id: I72a90d7ab141670d4219c53e16766823d95bd0e5

commit_message:
New release for pylockfile

Next attempt at releasing pylockfile. 0.12.0 and
0.12.1 did not end up on pypi.

0.12.0 - pypi-extract-universal.py used an old config option
         [wheel]/universal and did not support the newer
         [bdist_wheel/universal. We tried to fix this in
         change id:
         I519acfc3080938fe0445705fc98df12201036c30
         I68b0cd547caf0c9161c983e7dc0f2259a96af762
0.12.1 - We tried this with the same SHA which failed again
         as there was a typo in the previous change. The new
         fix as made in:
         I68b0cd547caf0c9161c983e7dc0f2259a96af762

Another problem was that gate-releases-tox-validate was
tripping when we used the same SHA for 0.12.0 and 0.12.1
So we touched up the README.rst of pylockfile to change
the SHA to make a new release for 0.12.2. Also, since
0.12.0 and 0.12.1 did not end up on pypi, we don't need
to list them here as well.

Change-Id: I8a94287a09c4ebbb5f5cbb661750a9d9cc5e036d

There are 2 ways to realize the privilege escalation needed for the gate jobs.

1) Editing the playbooks (and hope to not forget to write the sudo/become lines for every role)

2) Editing the inventory and set the variable there.

I'm taking the second approach with the minimum set of variables (become_method is sudo by default and become_user is root by default).

Change-Id: I54b8c1489bfc46d4a03c907f4a86f0313c7778ff

commit_message:
Use sudo for role testing

There are 2 ways to realize the privilege escalation
needed for the gate jobs.

1) Editing the playbooks (and hope to not forget to
write the sudo/become lines for every role)
2) Editing the inventory and set the variable there.

I'm taking the second approach with the minimum set
of variables (become_method is sudo by default and
become_user is root by default).

Change-Id: I54b8c1489bfc46d4a03c907f4a86f0313c7778ff

commit_message:
Fix v2 qos-key command

As part of commit 0d2bf657ae5271a01e9ec84d379d17910b263b7e,
qos-key command's v2 support got broken again reintroducing
bug #1284321.

Change-Id: I30d60b060bd1b161bc96c4a529f4732b9ceef90d
Closes-Bug: 1284321

commit_message:
Remove the TestRemoteObject class

This class is now testing only things that exist (and are tested) in
oslo.versionedobjects. Remove this class from what we test in nova.

[{'created': '2015-10-22 15:44:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make OVS interface name hashing algorithm common and extend it

The OVS devcie name hashing algorithm shortens interface names that are too
long. To ensure uniqueness it takes use of a hashing algorithm.

Move this function to a common place where it can be shared between ml2
drivers and agents.

Extend the function to support interface name postfix in addition to the
prefix. Allow defining the max device length.

Change LOG level to info to help deployers figuring out the unhashed name
of an hashed inteface.

Adapt OVS and linuxbridge agent to use this common function instead of their
own implementation.

commit_message:
ovs: Make interface name hashing algorithm common and extend it

The OVS device name hashing algorithm shortens interface names that are too
long. To ensure uniqueness it makes use of a hashing algorithm.

Move this function to a common place where it can be shared between ml2
drivers and agents.

Extend the function to support defining the max device length to be used.

Change LOG level to info to help deployers figuring out the unhashed name
of an hashed inteface.

Adapt OVS agent to use this common function instead of its
own implementation.

Change-Id: I5c04f39928d070aa7e372934fcb2675609d2761c
Partial-Bug: #1495960

commit_message:
Removing wait() when initializing notification listener

According to [1],the correct usage is to call stop() before wait(), so in
mistral case, we should never call stop() and wait() in initialization of
engine and executor service.

[1]:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.messaging/notification_listener.html

Change-Id: Ic6a802bff35a6a6fdfadf38474782efd12fd34d8
Closes-Bug: #1514459
(cherry picked from commit ec28a305d91139ef5d307fa56ad289a635e37a90)

subject: Fix state change on exception during task state change
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-25 06:49:08.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_direct_workflow.py', 'mistral/engine/default_engine.py'], 'message': 'Fix state change on exception during task state change

If there is an exception during on_task_state_change, particularly if
there is a YAQL evaluation error in the input of the next task, the state
of the current task and related action execution will be marked ERROR for
sync task and rolled back for async task, leaving the task as orphaned in
RUNNING state in most cases. This is a workflow handling error and the
workflow execution state is already marked ERROR. The state of the current
task execution should not be affected.

Change-Id: Id28b0661c09efa80a666d9eb7606fb435641a989
Closes-Bug: #1510738
(cherry picked from commit 93b19335f5992f74ac0edcd4f95c0ad06d101b74)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix state change on exception during task state change

If there is an exception during on_task_state_change, particularly if
there is a YAQL evaluation error in the input of the next task, the state
of the current task and related action execution will be marked ERROR for
sync task and rolled back for async task, leaving the task as orphaned in
RUNNING state in most cases. This is a workflow handling error and the
workflow execution state is already marked ERROR. The state of the current
task execution should not be affected.

Change-Id: Id28b0661c09efa80a666d9eb7606fb435641a989
Closes-Bug: #1510738
(cherry picked from commit 93b19335f5992f74ac0edcd4f95c0ad06d101b74)

commit_message:
Only log errors in exceptions on demand

Rather than error logging all of them, allow the user a mechanism
to error log the ones they care about. Also make inner_exception
public so that people can make their own choices.

Change-Id: I15973f52d3d68c24ac8ef7643a53ff0118e892cf

commit_message:
Update requirements to suit the existence of lxc vg

If lxc volume group exists, the aio will try to use
this volume group to create the containers.

As one container will use a hard 5GB of storage, and
the fact that (by default) there is more than 16
containers, you'll exhaust all your storage space
and the aio build will fail.

This commit should make this failure more clear to
openstack-ansible users.

The amount of disk is counted with the default
install.

Change-Id: I84f68a24423f9e7046b1235ef51bf2291708fcec
(cherry picked from commit dfc544fed974c81d7542ff8167d6a4143914c79c)

subject: Output the SSL Certificate and Key modulus
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'shardy@redhat.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 14369, 'name': 'Mark Chappell', 'email': 'mchappel@redhat.com', 'username': 'tremble'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-04 11:31:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Output the SSL Certificate and Key modulus

Provides a simple mechanism to verify the correct certificates
landed.

A quick and simple way to verify SSL certificates were generated for
a given key is by comparing the modulus of the two.  By outputing
the key modulus and certificate modulus we offer a way to verify
that the right cert and key have been deployed without compromising

commit_message:
Output the SSL Certificate and Key modulus

Provides a simple mechanism to verify the correct certificates
landed.

A quick and simple way to verify SSL certificates were generated for
a given key is by comparing the modulus of the two.  By outputing
the key modulus and certificate modulus we offer a way to verify
that the right cert and key have been deployed without compromising
any of the secrets.

Change-Id: I882c9840719a09795ba8057a19b0b3985e036c3c

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-03 13:38:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Enable trust anchor injection

This commit enables the injection of a trust anchor or root certificate
into every node in the overcloud. This is in case that the TLS
certificates for the controllers are signed with a self-signed CA. In
this case the other nodes might need to have the root certificate in
their trust chain in order to do proper validation

Change-Id: Ia45180fe0bb979cf12d19f039dbfd22e26fb4856

commit_message:
Enable trust anchor injection

This commit enables the injection of a trust anchor or root
certificate into every node in the overcloud. This is in case that the
TLS certificates for the controllers are signed with a self-signed CA
or if the deployer would like to inject a relevant root certificate
for other purposes. In this case the other nodes might need to have
the root certificate in their trust chain in order to do proper
validation

Change-Id: Ia45180fe0bb979cf12d19f039dbfd22e26fb4856

commit_message:
New git dotfiles for independant repository

This will make git review workflow work within this role
This will also prevent undesired files.

Change-Id: I2482314d50cff8f72febf853018d1c6e212216e9

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-07 11:33:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Enable TLS deployment for the Overcloud

This is a first implementation of adding TLS termination to the load
balancer in the controllers. The implementation was made so that the
appropriate certificate/private key in PEM format is copied to the
controllers via cloud-init. And the path is then referenced on the
HAProxy configuration.

It might also be needed to install proper trust anchors for those
certificates to work; So such a capability was added in a similar
fashion.

commit_message:
Inject TLS certificate and keys for the Overcloud

This is a first implementation of adding TLS termination to the load
balancer in the controllers. The implementation was made so that the
appropriate certificate/private key in PEM format is copied to the
appropriate controller(s) via a software deployment resource.

And the path is then referenced on the HAProxy configuration, but this
part was left commented out because we need to be able to configure the
keystone endpoints in order for this to work properly.

Change-Id: I0ba8e38d75a0c628d8132a66dc25a30fc5183c79

commit_message:
Use sudo for role testing

There are 2 ways to realize the privilege escalation needed
for the gate jobs.

1) Editing the playbooks (and hope to not forget to write the
sudo/become lines for every role)
2) Editing the inventory and set the variable there.

I'm taking the second approach with the minimum
set of variables (become_method is sudo by default
and become_user is root by default).

Change-Id: I4f7d423ad2d21611c466ec6bb58d45c5a2fd00b9

commit_message:
config options: remove invalid help text assignment

config options help texts won't get translated. This patch set
removes the translation helper. It also removes the assignment
of a help text as a tuple.

Change-Id: Iecea9576154fef8e1d4d8f3d2635bbb30cad2f7f

subject: Remove 'sqlalchemy' from requirements.txt
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-25 16:35:29.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': "Remove 'sqlalchemy' from requirements.txt

Having that requirement here can cause installation problems - please
see the bug for details.

networking-calico does use sqlalchemy, but it works fine to allow it
to be pulled in by Neutron, and so not to depend explicitly upon it.

Change-Id: I21b17844df0c369d743e18c9bfd41fc4255b4b3e
Closes-Bug: #1519884
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove 'sqlalchemy' from requirements.txt

Having that requirement here can cause installation problems - please
see the bug for details.

networking-calico does use sqlalchemy, but it works fine to allow it
to be pulled in by Neutron, and so not to depend explicitly upon it.

Change-Id: I21b17844df0c369d743e18c9bfd41fc4255b4b3e
Closes-Bug: #1519884

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-11 19:22:31.000000000', 'files': ['designate/central/service.py', 'designate/pool_manager/service.py'], 'message': "Handle NO_DOMAIN status

Previous to this patch, when MiniDNS got a `NO_DOMAIN` status back,
it didn't do anything to handle it. Domains just hung in ERROR.

closes-bug: #1416264

	designate/tests/unit/test_central/test_basic.py

Change-Id: I4348f714868f38c2549c516fe83cce608c0c8d59

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Handle NO_DOMAIN status

Previous to this patch, when MiniDNS got a `NO_DOMAIN` status back,
it didn't do anything to handle it. Domains just hung in ERROR.

closes-bug: #1416264

Conflicts:
	designate/tests/unit/test_central/test_basic.py

Change-Id: I4348f714868f38c2549c516fe83cce608c0c8d59
(cherry picked from commit ed2861a0193e2b5ebbb89a8d8fb04fdded976483)

subject: Remove ssh args to ensure pipelining is working
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-24 18:15:57.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/ansible.cfg'], 'message': 'Remove ssh args to ensure pipelining is working

The ssh args that we have been carrying are overriding
base functionality in Ansible which can cause intermitent
issues. To correct this issue I removed our ssh-args which
will use the default ssh arguments provided by ansible core.

Change-Id: If61d875a58e466ec07cb6818040e83f1612b4f18
Related-Bug: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/9246
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove ssh args to ensure pipelining is working

The ssh args that we have been carrying are overriding
base functionality in Ansible which can cause intermitent
issues. To correct this issue I removed our ssh-args which
will use the default ssh arguments provided by ansible core.

Change-Id: If61d875a58e466ec07cb6818040e83f1612b4f18
Related-Bug: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/9246
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
[WIP] Move simple nodes operations out of manager.py

This is the second patch in a chain of refactoring patches in preparation
for moving to Futurist library. See blueprint futurist for details.

New mixin class node_ops.NodeOps is added with the moved operations.

Change-Id: I3c58a2ef1083c7d4f18ff5950c785695b179e2aa

commit_message:
Use sudo for role testing

There are 2 ways to realize the privilege escalation
needed for the gate jobs.

1) Editing the playbooks (and hope to not forget to
write the sudo/become lines for every role)
2) Editing the inventory and set the variable there.

I'm taking the second approach with the minimum set
of variables (become_method is sudo by default and
become_user is root by default).

Change-Id: Iab4a1deda78669fd2a5e3e18c5b86afdffde0cf8

commit_message:
Rename semantic-version dep to semantic_version

The package is actually named semantic_version, not semantic-version. This is
known to cause errors in old pip versions and with non standard setups,
so lets name it correctly.

Change-Id: Ie5709ccc9d67ee221c2c00d6202f8e48b66da80e

commit_message:
Fixing SSH actions to use names of private keys

 * SSH action uses private key names instead of
   private keys themself. All private keys now
   should be in <user-home>/.ssh/, e.g. searching
   of key 'my_key.pem' will be at <user-home>/.ssh/my_key.pem
 * Fixed functional tests
 * Remove sudo while running tests

Closes-Bug: #1507600

Change-Id: I503d78ff541183ce850476229842fa6f20061a00
(cherry picked from commit 56f2d5f4b5603f457e6b4eb5b0a699471b658f9c)

commit_message:
Use sudo for role testing

There are 2 ways to realize the privilege escalation
needed for the gate jobs.

1) Editing the playbooks (and hope to not forget to
write the sudo/become lines for every role)
2) Editing the inventory and set the variable there.

I'm taking the second approach with the minimum set
of variables (become_method is sudo by default and
become_user is root by default).

Change-Id: Ic90ec52b849c8e227084071e80cea87140a049d5

commit_message:
Handle concurrent deletion in periodic resync thread

See https://github.com/projectcalico/calico/issues/914 for full
discussion.  In summary, for this scenario we need to catch
EtcdKeyNotFound as well as EtcdCompareFailed.

Change-Id: I49652e33639a68c1a68c162bc57b240fbdd0181b
Closes-Bug: #1519795

commit_message:
Change MODULEPATH env variable in config generator

MODULEPATH is a well known variable from environment-modules package.
This changes to a different one for our case.

UpgradeImpact: MODULEPATH env var in config generator changes to
CONFIG_GENERATOR

Change-Id: I4ef5834c0605d6c7c69514bf6fff189ad1379fb1
Closes-Bug: #1437904

commit_message:
cleanup sahara commands

this change will migrate the "sahara" process name to "sahara-all" to
provide greater clarity on what service process is running.

* change start process to sahara-all
* change stop process to sahara-all
* add a sahara-all detection to is_service_enabled
* remove dirname usage in favor of GITDIR environment variable for the
  shutdown script

Change-Id: I80b82edbc6023d4dc28f005fecd8f2138809bbe3

commit_message:
Implement new random name generator for wrapper plugins

This switches all wrapper plugins to use the new consistent random
name generator.

Implements blueprint: consistent-resource-names
Change-Id: I6b27fe2f41d84c1961db3b13cf8ddeeae27a6591

commit_message:
Support shares in sahara cluster templates

Since 0.10.0 python-saharaclient has ability to specify
shares parameter when creating cluster templates.
This patch adds support for this feature to
OS::Sahara::ClusterTemplate resource in Heat.

Change-Id: I44533f79cc8e95e6c41edf08f54f86370d6fd5e2

subject: Decrypting Container Listing
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 12261, 'name': 'Mahati', 'email': 'mahati.chamarthy@gmail.com', 'username': 'Mahati'}, {'_account_id': 12279, 'name': 'Janie Richling', 'email': 'jrichli@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'jrichli'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 17156, 'name': 'Hamdi Roumani', 'email': 'roumani@ca.ibm.com', 'username': 'hroumani'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-19 03:48:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Decrypting Container Listing

See encryption spec in_progress/at_rest_encryption.html

Decrypts the content-type in the container-listing.
The content-length is modified since decoding decreases length.
When there is "footers" support, the etag will also be decrypted.

Depends on having keymaster middleware and cryptography module.
You can point the following vagrant to this patch:
https://github.com/swiftstack/vagrant-swift-all-in-one/tree/crypto
Alternatively, please follow the instructions
in the proxy-server.conf-sample.  You will also need to add the
fake_footers middleware as well to get the correct functionality.

After this change, the functests have 8 (or 9) errors and 17 failures.
These are due to not having COPY implemented,
and not having a solution for handling conditional GET.

Change-Id: If7830ed0fc17deb3939492a02a3e07a20f1018c7

commit_message:
Decrypting Container Listing

See encryption spec in_progress/at_rest_encryption.html

Decrypts the content-type in the container-listing.
The content-length is modified since decoding decreases length.
When there is "footers" support, the etag will also be decrypted.

Depends on having keymaster middleware and cryptography module.
You can point the following vagrant to this patch:
https://github.com/swiftstack/vagrant-swift-all-in-one/tree/crypto
Alternatively, please follow the instructions
in the proxy-server.conf-sample.  You will also need to add the
fake_footers middleware as well to get the correct functionality.

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hp.com>

Change-Id: If7830ed0fc17deb3939492a02a3e07a20f1018c7

[{'created': '2015-10-16 20:13:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Rename fernet methods to match expiration timestamp

Fernet tokens carry the token creation time as part of the Fernet
specification, which is an integer. This is not the case with the token
expiration time, which is carried in the payload of the Fernet token. Keystone
converts the timestamp to a floating point value to save space in the token.
Previously, all the methods handling this conversion, along with the related
tests, communicated that this conversion was to an integer instead of a
float. This change corrects the methods signatures in the Fernet token provider
to be consistent with the timestamp type that is used in the implementation.

Change-Id: Ibea9fa0d546948501ebcd9f9f826b1f1319246f2

commit_message:
Rename fernet methods to match expiration timestamp

Fernet tokens carry the token creation time as part of the Fernet
specification, which is an integer. This is not the case with the token
expiration time, which is carried in the payload of the Fernet token. Keystone
converts the timestamp to a floating point value to save space in the token.
Previously, all the methods handling this conversion, along with the related
tests, communicated that this conversion was to an integer instead of a
float. This change corrects the methods signatures in the Fernet token provider
to be consistent with the timestamp type that is used in the implementation.

Conflicts:
	keystone/token/providers/fernet/token_formatters.py

Change-Id: Ibea9fa0d546948501ebcd9f9f826b1f1319246f2
(cherry picked from commit 94904b305b74e4e9e1b70b7c6e1351febdd6862d)

commit_message:
Optimize router delete execution

Optimize the execution of router delete in the L3 agent
by not performing operations in the router namespace that
will be removed as the last step of the workflow.
Comparing the slopes of the least squares fit of delete
execution time shows that this optimization decreases that
slope by over half.

Change-Id: Ic425ab1f8c3afe882c9deaa72a814ac0d2053f3b
Signed-off-by: Ryan Moats <rmoats@us.ibm.com>
Closes-Bug: 1512450

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-02 10:09:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "swift-init return codes

Currently, swift-init returns 0 if can't locate config on start.
Because of this problem, it is not possible to distinguish
if managed to start server.

In order to unify return codes the action start returns 0
only if all demanded servers manage to start.

Changing return codes for this options:
If can't locate config, returns 1.
If some of demanded servers already running, returns 1.

Change-Id: I7750abd4a94875b46f83f4aeee8509388d543c2b
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-19 19:15:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "swift-init return codes

Because of this problem, it is not possible to distinguish
if managed to start server.

In order to unify return codes the action start returns 0

commit_message:
swift-init return codes

Currently, swift-init returns zero if can't locate config on start.
Because of this problem, it is not possible to distinguish if managed
to start server.

Due to legacy two new complementary options are added. Default is context
dependent.
--strict returns non-zero if some config is missing (default mode
if explicitly named server)
--non-strict returns zero even if some config is missing (default mode
if alias is used)

As a side effect:
If some of demanded servers already running it does not try to start
unstarted and also returns non-zero (in strict mode). That is still sufficient
for the goal of patch.

For future improvements LSB status codes should be considered.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I7750abd4a94875b46f83f4aeee8509388d543c2b

subject: Fix releasenotes post job
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-20 21:44:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix releasenotes post job

Use zuul-branch-git-prep macro, the branch-git-prep does not work in the
post queue (gerrit-git-prep script still gets ZUUL_BRANCH and checks out
a stable branch instead of desired master) to check out master as
intented.

Using zuul-branch-git-prep we can now for any change publish the release
notes from *master*.

Also, only run the job on liberty and newer branches - incl. master - since
older branches do not have reno based releasenotes entries.

Change-Id: Icce6440278c6606528f8f601da76b2af0a1f12e9

commit_message:
Fix releasenotes post job

Use zuul-git-branch-prep macro, the branch-git-prep does not work in the
post queue (gerrit-git-prep script still gets ZUUL_BRANCH and checks out
a stable branch instead of desired master) to check out master as
intented.

Using zuul-git-branch-prep we can now for any change publish the release
notes from *master*.

This fixes also zuul-git-branch-prep, we need to properly quote the
function.

Also, only run the job on liberty and newer branches - incl. master - since
older branches do not have reno based releasenotes entries.

Change-Id: Icce6440278c6606528f8f601da76b2af0a1f12e9

commit_message:
Configure etcd DB location

Determine the etcd DB file location in order to know how to clean
it on stack.
This eliminate the problems when the start_db_server method is
moved.

Change-Id: I4965211e8c748266c0e36ccaed7f348617ed272f

commit_message:
[WIP] Rewrote the Ansible SSH plugin

In Ansible 1.9.x there are a few areas where the SSH plugin
could / should be updated to better support the systems it
interacts with. This PR updated the SSH connection plugin
such that it is now smarter in how the various methods write, 
update, and modifies data in flight while also being more 
pythonic / easy to read.

Change-Id: I60d4962d31024109f3aa610173fb3e068aaeadbb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Set ext[234] images superblock timestamps to a distant past
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-02 15:28:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Set ext[234] images superblock timestamps to a distant past

e2fsck is very picky about timestamps: the last write time being in the future
considered an error. Thus provisioning an image on a machine which is not
syncronised with the one where the image has been built requires extra
effort (creating a custom /etc/e2fsck.conf file) and might possibly affect
the regular filesystems checks (during the OS boot).
To avoid the problem set the superblock timestamps of ext2/3/4 filesystems
images built by fuel-agent to a distant past.

* utils.fs: add functions for ext[234] superblock timestamps manipulation
* shrink_sparse_file: reset the superblock timestamps after resizing the image

Change-Id: Ifae51726aed4f221d7715ff9aa11310f9c540188

commit_message:
Set ext[234] images superblock timestamps to a distant past

e2fsck is very picky about timestamps: the last write time being in the future
considered an error. Thus provisioning an image on a machine which is not
syncronised with the one where the image has been built requires extra
effort (creating a custom /etc/e2fsck.conf file) and might possibly affect
the regular filesystems checks (during the OS boot).
To avoid the problem set the superblock timestamps of ext2/3/4 filesystems
images built by fuel-agent to a distant past.

* utils.fs: add functions for ext[234] superblock timestamps manipulation
* shrink_sparse_file: reset the superblock timestamps after resizing the image

Change-Id: Ifae51726aed4f221d7715ff9aa11310f9c540188

commit_message:
utils.execute: implement passing input via 'process_input' kwarg

Being unable to pass an input to a command is a very annoying restriction.
For now the input can be passed to a single process only (as opposed to
a pipeline of commands).

Note: oslo_concurrency.processutils.execute uses the `process_input' keyword
argument for the same purpose, hence the name.

Change-Id: I448efad452519d3140832fb94ed7b783ae256613

commit_message:
Kilo backport

Service_provider in neutron.conf
	In kilo it is not possible to add service
	provider config. Thats why the configuration has
	to be set in neutron.conf

Add namespace to extension
	In kilo an extension for neutron still
	needs a get_namespace method.

Hack around neutrons fixed plugin rules
	The list of allowed services is fixed in kilo.
	This commit adds BGPVPN to the allowed services.

Align unittests to kilo
	bgpvpn_id is given in kwargs not in args.

Align requirements to stable/kilo

	It is necessary to align the test-requirements
	to the main openstack projects.

Change-Id: I3b5fa02af73c6111d38a7e99f372e25e2e469510

commit_message:
do_build_image: move image creation to a helper method

Move the code which actually makes compressed filesystem images
of the installed/configured OS from do_build_image into a helper
method. The next patch will implement the make_bootstrap_image
method which packs the OS as a bootstrap image, that is, a tarball
containing a squashfs root filesystem, kernel, initramfs, and
a metadata.

Change-Id: Ia10056e70c060ca37515d0e03fce797fe3bed97d
Implements: blueprint dynamically-build-bootstrap

commit_message:
Various leader election improvements:

* Reduce startup timer to reduce time without a leader after restart;
  this is sensible now that we're relying on leader election to
  nominate the status reporting thread.
* Opportunistically check if the previous master is still alive if
  we happen to start on the same server.  Reduces time to get a new
  master after restarting neutron.
* Add additional diags in hope of diagnosing election bouncing seen
  in #775 and #869.  Possible starvation of elector?

Change-Id: Ic84c8316a1cd26a77f3799ea0f4f96a2e438e987
Closes-Bug: #1519830

Update automatic API endpoints

This patch updates the Debconf API endpoints bash script
to reflect what is done within the up-to-date
openstack-pkg-tools. Ie: using Keystone v3 API instead
of v2.

commit_message:
Fixed haproxy backend config issue

The change updates the haproxy configs to use backends with a
default of an empty array. This is needed to ensure that the backends
are not being assumed to have some value. In the current system if an
inventory item did not exist the rendered backend would be a jinja
string which would cause the haproxy play to fail.

Closes-Bug: #1513455

Change-Id: I221dbd910c75c2e41c98a33e1c38c7f69718b544
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 589650228bb2678487b5750688fe403095955db7)

commit_message:
Remove keystone directives from api-paste file

Remove next directives from api-paste authtoken section
and put them to cinder.conf instead:

* auth_uri
* auth_host
* auth_protocol
* auth_port
* admin_tenant_name
* admin_user
* admin_password
* identity_uri

Also there are some deleted fields cause they don't
uses anymore in config:

* service_host
* service_port
* service_protocol

Change-Id: Idab40f63e962293e59ac2cc2f7dc95ed474f74e6
Closes-Bug: #1500384

commit_message:
add comment explaining why we don't want extra values passed to mask_password

We have the same conversation every 6 months or so. Let's document our
reasoning here so folks are less likely to waste time adding new
arguments to the function and having their patch rejected.

Related-Bug: #1407811
Change-Id: I0d0a30a1256ddc34edce6c312abe9a53fa8ac7ae

commit_message:
Fixed updating of JSON fields in database

Replaced JSON objects on MutableDict objects to
support partitial changes of JSON fields in database.
Changed ActionLog and NetworkGroup objects.

commit_message:
Adds methods for setting vm boot order

This patch adds methods for setting boot order for both first
generation vms and second generation vms.

Partially implements: blueprint hyper-v-block-device-mapping-support

Change-Id: Ieea770514ddaadcc15bbd83bf5c16bb256e0a4e5

subject: Fixes bug: wrong wmi call in vmutils._modify_virtual_system method
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-23 09:22:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixes bug: wrong wmi call in vmutils._modify_virtual_system method

The method modify_virtual_system from vmutils calls ModifyVirtualSystem
method of the wmi class Msvm_VirtualSystemManagementService [1].
This is wrong since it is supported only in the virtualization\v1
namespace, not in v2.

The appropriate methods to call should be, ModifySystemSettings [2].

[1] https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc136809(v=vs.85).aspx
[2] https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh850104(v=vs.85).aspx

Change-Id: I5a454d2a31b81c54552328bcdd6bf473ea21d7ff
Closes-Bug: #1518889
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-25 13:45:54.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/utils/compute/vmutils.py', 'os_win/tests/utils/compute/test_vmutils.py'], 'message': 'Fixes bug: wrong wmi call in vmutils._modify_virtual_system method

The method modify_virtual_system from vmutils calls ModifyVirtualSystem
method of the wmi class Msvm_VirtualSystemManagementService [1].
This is wrong since it is supported only in the virtualization\v1
namespace, not in v2.

The appropriate methods to call should be, ModifySystemSettings [2].

[1] https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc136809(v=vs.85).aspx
[2] https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh850104(v=vs.85).aspx

commit_message:
Fixes bug: wrong wmi call in vmutils._modify_virtual_system method

The method modify_virtual_system from vmutils calls ModifyVirtualSystem
method of the wmi class Msvm_VirtualSystemManagementService [1].
This is wrong since it is supported only in the virtualization\v1
namespace, not in v2.

The appropriate methods to call should be, ModifySystemSettings [2].

[1] https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc136809(v=vs.85).aspx
[2] https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh850104(v=vs.85).aspx

Change-Id: I5a454d2a31b81c54552328bcdd6bf473ea21d7ff
Closes-Bug: #1518889

commit_message:
Convert OVSDB APIs to commands

The correct way to send transactions to OVSDB is using
the transaction queue and not directly.
This change alters the remaining API to work like that.

Change-Id: I667cbbb6e6093a99734cde9998cf381e609d4e47

commit_message:
Take over console session if enabled

Currently there's no support for taking over console session,
just leave the console_enabled status True, but no shellinabox
process running. This patch tries to start console in the new
conductor and sets console_enabled to False if failed.

Closes-Bug: #1519725
Change-Id: I62a83aa8adb8d73248e1a8dd6f840263fa60ae60

commit_message:
Add fuel-setup-network to contrib directory

fuel-setup-network is a simple script that makes setting up networking
on master node deployed via fuel-devops easier.

It takes environment name as mandatory argument and allows to specify
environment id with -i (or --id).

Change-Id: I50fc4bb9f55baad8fc1e5606ec968ed207fb340a

commit_message:
Clean all flows on controller restart

This patch adds commands to delete and set controller
to the vswitch API and also delete and reset the controller
on restart (which clears all configured flows and re-configure them)

Closes-Bug: #1518709

Change-Id: I715d2919be3a2f6dcc95f9ad380a7cc1dfc121a7

subject: SwiftAPI constructor should read CONF variables at runtime
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-24 06:21:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[WIP] SwiftAPI should loads CONF variables on runtime

Today ironic.common.swift.SwiftAPI loads CONF variables
in the constructor as default arguments.  The problem
with this approach is that it is dependent on the external
libraries for these values to be initialized when this
module is loaded.  To prevent this, these values should
be fetched at runtime when required.

Change-Id: I218c19dd908911140ca4640740b7dcdf2c3454ed
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-25 11:50:30.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/common/swift.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/common/test_swift.py'], 'message': 'SwiftAPI constructor should read CONF variables at runtime

Recently the patch Ic7865709cd87c45e6b7d49f15ce73354aa15401e
added some new imports in ironic.common.service, which caused
the following to be loaded in chain:

 ironic.api.app ->
  ironic.api.hooks ->
    ironic.conductor.rpcapi ->
      ironic.conductor.manager ->
        ironic.common.swift

Today ironic.common.swift.SwiftAPI reads value of some CONF
variables in the constructor as default arguments.  The
default values for the constructor is read at code initialization
time and same value is used subsequently on all calls. Because
the order of import was altered, code in swift.SwiftAPI was
initialized before ironic.conf was parsed in
config.parse_args (in ironic.common.service itself). The change
in this order caused all the default values to have None.

This commit stops the SwiftAPI from setting default values in
constructor method. It changes SwiftAPI.__init__() to set the
values for user, tenant from CONF at runtime if they were not
passed.

Closes-Bug: 1519774
Change-Id: I218c19dd908911140ca4640740b7dcdf2c3454ed
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
SwiftAPI constructor should read CONF variables at runtime

Recently the patch Ic7865709cd87c45e6b7d49f15ce73354aa15401e
added some new imports in ironic.common.service, which caused
the following to be loaded in chain:

 ironic.api.app ->
  ironic.api.hooks ->
    ironic.conductor.rpcapi ->
      ironic.conductor.manager ->
        ironic.common.swift

Today ironic.common.swift.SwiftAPI reads value of some CONF
variables in the constructor as default arguments.  The
default values for the constructor is read at code initialization
time and same value is used subsequently on all calls. Because
the order of import was altered, code in swift.SwiftAPI was
initialized before ironic.conf was parsed in
config.parse_args (in ironic.common.service itself). The change
in this order caused all the default values to have None.

This commit stops the SwiftAPI from setting default values in
constructor method. It changes SwiftAPI.__init__() to set the
values for user, tenant from CONF at runtime if they were not
passed.

Closes-Bug: 1519774
Change-Id: I218c19dd908911140ca4640740b7dcdf2c3454ed

commit_message:
Fix Babel polyfill location

It was moved out of app.js dependencies and made a separate
entry point - this will guarantee it will be loaded before any
other module which might use ES6-specific objects and methods.

Change-Id: I4899d53112720131cf8634d8a7f489878d096639

commit_message:
Fixed issue with cacert parameter

We need to use parameter cacert instead of ca_file parameter
to work with CA certificates like python clients for other
OpenStack services.

Also fixed typo (after copy paste from Glance code).

(cherry picked from commit 1141dd59aff141bee6618806a4496b57c214c7c1)

Change-Id: Ibe36390aab2f2edb0fe7670f76f61caeb350d34b
Closes-Bug: #1487099

commit_message:
[WIP]Adds deployment configuration methods

This patch adds a deployment configuration manager.

Available deployment parameters can be listed based on a given plan's
data. These params can be updated with new values which results in
another validation through the heat API.

In addition to this, available deployment roles can be listed.

Change-Id: I3874a952c83ba316f347351da51890ee9b7050a8

directly now.

subject: Fixup neutron constraints in older overclouds before updating
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-23 08:38:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixup neutron constraints in older overclouds before updating

The neutron pcs constraints were reworked in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/229466/

For overclouds deployed with older tripleo-heat-templates the
current pcs ordering constraints will not have those changes,
meaning that the behaviour discussed at
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1501378 is likely
given we will stop and restart all services. This review
applies those, in short, remove the ovs-cleanup after
neutron-server and add openvswitch-agent instead. Detail in
the bug report and linked BZ.

Change-Id: I45822c5fe9029f11635400b7fbd386880ac80a4e
Related-Bug: 1501378
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-23 13:07:16.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/yum_update.sh'], 'message': 'Fixup neutron constraints in older overclouds before updating

', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fixup neutron constraints in older overclouds before updating

The neutron pcs constraints were reworked in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/229466/

For overclouds deployed with older tripleo-heat-templates the
current pcs ordering constraints will not have those changes,
meaning that the behaviour discussed at
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1501378 is likely
given we will stop and restart all services. This review
applies those, in short, remove the ovs-cleanup after
neutron-server and add openvswitch-agent instead. Detail in
the bug report and linked BZ.

Change-Id: I45822c5fe9029f11635400b7fbd386880ac80a4e
Related-Bug: 1501378

commit_message:
Add support for unicast DHCP requests

DHCP client will start sending unicast messages by the Renewal
Time Value (T1), and unicast and broadcast from Rebinding
Time Value (T2). By default this values are 50 percent of the
lease time for T1 and 87.5 percent for T2

Currently we do not set this values in our SDN based DHCP server
and we let the client use its defaults.

Change-Id: Ie77dba7be9182de5a9e44eed9cec0a58c66cef82

subject: Use consistent argument names for find proxies
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-25 03:39:07.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/cluster/v1/_proxy.py', 'openstack/network/v2/_proxy.py'], 'message': 'Use consistent argument names for find proxies

A grep of the argument names for find proxies showed 60 using the
`name_or_id` positional argument and 5 using `value`. This change brings
them all in line to be the same, `name_or_id`.

Change-Id: Ide2a1b2e201bf1b0a712464e9c1d77f2214ccfc8
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use consistent argument names for find proxies

A grep of the argument names for find proxies showed 60 using the
`name_or_id` positional argument and 5 using `value`. This change brings
them all in line to be the same, `name_or_id`.

Change-Id: Ide2a1b2e201bf1b0a712464e9c1d77f2214ccfc8

commit_message:
Cleanup doc references to past modules

As we've recently moved to KSA, there are several remaining references
to things like our old transport code as well as the included auth
plugin code. In order to have the docs building cleanly, this change
removes anything that no longer exists. A separate change can properly
document anything necessary to add.

subject: bagpipe: port delete action on BEFORE_DELETE event
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-24 09:10:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "bagpipe: port delete action on BEFORE_DELETE event

Details on the issue in bug #1517480.

We need to subscribe to port before_delete events, because
on after_delete events the port is already removed from the db
and we can't retrieve the binding:host_id information (which
is not passed in the event either).

This change also include a unit test against this bug, which also
happens to go through the ML2 RPC-to-registry codepaths so that
the effect of real registry events against our code are tested, thus
testing the validity of the expectation that the bagpipe driver code
has against ML2. This addresses bug #1493901.

One test is not passing, and thus commented out: see bug 1519258.

Closes-Bug: 1517480
Closes-Bug: 1493901

Change-Id: Icce89d98bcc4424529dcbe661fed3c1c8191418c

commit_message:
bagpipe: port delete action on BEFORE_DELETE event

Details on the issue in bug #1517480.

We need to subscribe to port before_delete events, because
on after_delete events the port is already removed from the db
and we can't retrieve the binding:host_id information (which
is not passed in the event either).

This change also include a unit test against this bug, which also
happens to go through the ML2 RPC-to-registry codepaths so that
the effect of real registry events against our code are tested, thus
testing the validity of the expectation that the bagpipe driver code
has against ML2. This addresses bug #1493901.

One test is not passing, and thus commented out: see bug 1519258.

Closes-Bug: 1517480
Closes-Bug: 1493901

Change-Id: Icce89d98bcc4424529dcbe661fed3c1c8191418c

commit_message:
Support shares in sahara clusters

Since 0.10.0 python-saharaclient has ability to specify
shares parameter when creating clusters.
This patch adds support for this feature to
OS::Sahara::Cluster resource in Heat.

Change-Id: If2e6b3a81f9fa5e507a39510042bcc9b394ef2de

commit_message:
Unblocks Gate-Use oslo_middleware

In recent release of oslo.middleware
(https://launchpad.net/oslo.middleware/+milestone/3.0.0)
removed the usage of oslo namespace, hence causing 
gating errors as we still have one reference to
oslo.middleware. This commit fixes the same.

UpgradeImpact
Change-Id: I6bb68c22dffc370a9745538d4d26db5137f29a7e

Milestone assignment is another mumbo jumbo effort in open source.
Artificially setting milestones implies that someone can reliably

For this reason let's make clear that we optmistically target the
current milestone for work that is supposed to start asap, and

commit_message:
Clarify how we milestones are assigned

Milestone assignment is another mumbo jumbo effort in open source.
Artificially setting milestones implies that someone can reliably
predict the future when no-one is really in full control.

For this reason let's make clear that we optmistically target the
current milestone for work that is supposed to start asap, and
complete sooner rather than later. Rolling over until the work is
complete is the natural course of action.

Dashboards [1] then capture the entire workload (BP and RFE) for
the entire release cycle, and that's helpful to provide to overall
view.

[1] https://launchpad.net/neutron/+milestone/<release>-?

Change-Id: Idb2d84ba683d2c8f1460e7bf0ff76d457cf42bce

commit_message:
Set DIB_INSTALLTYPE_puppet_modules for master/stable

Currently we override in CI so we install puppet modules from source
for master, meaning that using tripleo.sh without manually overriding
the DIB_INSTALLTYPE doesn't work (the pinned modules are too old).

Conversely, for stable/liberty, we want to use the stable packaged
version as building from-master modules won't work.

Change-Id: I07f3bf081feb4a2dad649600cd67a5c80f6a04a9
(cherry picked from commit f1eea658aa08a0c4348cc0f8a9e3faed766cb662)

[{'created': '2015-11-16 15:22:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Convergence: Fix duplicate events for stack actions

When stack actions such as suspend/resume/snapshot/restore are
completed, two events are logged in DB.

The above stack actions still use stack lock even under convergence.
Hence when setting the stack action as complete/failed, state_set
should not persist state.
Sending notification, events and saving Complete/Failed state in DB
is done at the time of releasing lock for these stack actions.

commit_message:
Convergence: Fix duplicate events for stack actions

When stack actions such as suspend/resume/snapshot/restore are
completed, two events are logged in DB.

The above stack actions still use stack lock even under convergence.
Hence when setting the stack action as complete/failed, state_set
should not persist state.
Sending notification, events and saving Complete/Failed state in DB
is done at the time of releasing lock for these stack actions.

Change-Id: Ib3e6c1de2f2f17502049e06ae484cb2e50867fab
Closes-Bug: #1516089

commit_message:
Enable PhantomJS for running Selenium tests

This patch enables the PhantomJS webdriver for running
the Selenium test suite.

Use it with the --selenium-phantomjs command-line switch
when executing the selenium and integration suite.

Change-Id: I443e6f6d7d1911df500b360f7c22686b417fbeae
Blueprint: enable-phantomjs-selenium

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-16 12:38:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "don't pass ceilometer options to oslo.db engine facade

oslo.db EngineFacade class only support options defined by oslo.db,
but we're passing options defined by ceilometer, so oslo.db complains
with a warning message:

NotSupportedWarning: Configuration option(s) ['alarm_connection', \
'alarm_history_time_to_live', 'db2nosql_resource_id_maxlen', \
'event_connection', 'event_time_to_live', 'metering_connection', \
'metering_time_to_live'] not supported exception.NotSupportedWarning

This patch makes sure only options defined by oslo.db will be sent
to EngineFacade

Change-Id: I2a39737a5f7824918c28ff2180f2ea95e7e82537
Closes-Bug: #1516515

commit_message:
don't pass ceilometer options to oslo.db engine facade

oslo.db EngineFacade class only support options defined by oslo.db,
but we're passing options defined by ceilometer, so oslo.db complains
with a warning message:

NotSupportedWarning: Configuration option(s) ['alarm_connection', \
'alarm_history_time_to_live', 'db2nosql_resource_id_maxlen', \
'event_connection', 'event_time_to_live', 'metering_connection', \
'metering_time_to_live'] not supported exception.NotSupportedWarning

This patch makes sure only options defined by oslo.db will be sent
to EngineFacade

Change-Id: I2a39737a5f7824918c28ff2180f2ea95e7e82537
Closes-Bug: #1516515

revisions:

The win32utils method retrieving error codes from HRESULTS

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-23 10:37:19.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/utils/win32utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix method retrieving error codes from HRESULTs

The win32utils method retrieving error codes from HRESULTS

should retrieve the last 2 bytes, otherwise returning

commit_message:
Fix method retrieving error codes from HRESULTs

The win32utils method retrieving error codes from HRESULTS
incorrectly fetches only the last HRESULT byte. Instead, it
should retrieve the last 2 bytes, otherwise returning
wrong error results for error codes greater than 255.

This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I43a7ef2ce44e454e395b65dfb41246d79a8f3587

commit_message:
Add retry decorator to the add_multiple_virt_features method

Adding virtual resources was consistently failing on our CIs,
especially when attaching the configdrive.

This patch attempts to fix this by adding the same decorator
that was used for the modify_virt_resource method, which had
avoided similar issues.

Change-Id: Ic9c8ffe1e1e33faf9037818ded1ddc3caf6d0aba

commit_message:
Set auth_plugin type to password when building sdk connection

Before the following change[1] being added into formal release of
openstacksdk, user needs to specify auth_plugin type explicitly
when building sdk connection. This patch revises creation_connection
method in senlin sdk driver to make it work.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/248929

Change-Id: I7cf1bfcd5047af80ff0b0843058be55dac7d7dc9
Closes-Bug: #1519684

subject: Speedup gathering pids from namespaces by OCF
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 11827, 'name': 'Stanislaw Bogatkin', 'email': 'regs+ubuntu.com@sbog.ru', 'username': 'sbogatkin'}, {'_account_id': 13343, 'name': 'Stanislav Makar', 'email': 'stas.makar@gmail.com', 'username': 'smakar'}, {'_account_id': 14610, 'name': 'Denis V. Meltsaykin', 'email': 'dmeltsaykin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dmeltsaykin'}, {'_account_id': 14689, 'name': 'Vitaly Sedelnik', 'email': 'vsedelnik@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vsedelnik'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-09 14:33:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Speedup gathering pids from namespaces by OCF

Currently, neutron OCF scripts are using `lsof` to gather pids of
processes running in particular namespace. `lsof` is extremely slow
due to inoptimal architecture and causes significant timeouts:
2+ minutes on 300 pids in 300 namespaces. On the other hand,
we cannot use `ip netns pids`, as this command is not present in
precise. The fix changes this call to the 2-stage execution inspired
by the original code of `ip netns pids`, which uses comparison of
the namespace inode with the `ns/net` symlink of the running
process that points to the required namespace. This scales about
linear: 1.7 seconds per 300 pids in 300 namespaces.

Closes-Bug: #1464815
Closes-Bug: #1405477

Change-Id: Ife3f5da3558bf4b5ddd0abbe997cd4b845a8d53c
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-25 11:56:57.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/cluster/files/ocf/neutron-agent-l3', 'deployment/puppet/cluster/files/ocf/neutron-agent-dhcp'], 'message': 'Speedup gathering pids from namespaces by OCF

Currently, neutron OCF scripts are using `lsof` to gather pids of
processes running in particular namespace. `lsof` is extremely slow
due to inoptimal architecture and causes significant timeouts:
2+ minutes on 300 pids in 300 namespaces. On the other hand,
we cannot use `ip netns pids`, as this command is not present in
precise. The fix changes this call to the 2-stage execution inspired
by the original code of `ip netns pids`, which uses comparison of
the namespace inode with the `ns/net` symlink of the running
process that points to the required namespace. This scales about
linear: 1.7 seconds per 300 pids in 300 namespaces.

Closes-Bug: #1464815
Closes-Bug: #1405477

Change-Id: Ife3f5da3558bf4b5ddd0abbe997cd4b845a8d53c

commit_message:
Speedup gathering pids from namespaces by OCF

Currently, neutron OCF scripts are using `lsof` to gather pids of
processes running in particular namespace. `lsof` is extremely slow
due to inoptimal architecture and causes significant timeouts:
2+ minutes on 300 pids in 300 namespaces. On the other hand,
we cannot use `ip netns pids`, as this command is not present in
precise. The fix changes this call to the 2-stage execution inspired
by the original code of `ip netns pids`, which uses comparison of
the namespace inode with the `ns/net` symlink of the running
process that points to the required namespace. This scales about
linear: 1.7 seconds per 300 pids in 300 namespaces.

Closes-Bug: #1464815
Closes-Bug: #1405477

Change-Id: Ife3f5da3558bf4b5ddd0abbe997cd4b845a8d53c

commit_message:
Use six.iteritems() instead of iter(XXX.items())

This patch changes the method iter(XXX.items()) to six.iteritems()

Change-Id: I178cfae85e0c128633f30236da565be8b2c7acc1

IloVirtualMediaBoot as its boot interface.

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-09 15:00:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'fix the bug of OSError when copy volume to image

When I try to upload volume to image in horizon, an error occurred
like this :
'''
2015-11-09 07:57:04.777 26189 ERROR oslo_messaging.rpc.dispatcher
File "/opt/stack/cinder/cinder/image/image_utils.py", line 129,
in _convert_image
2015-11-09 07:57:04.777 26189 ERROR oslo_messaging.rpc.dispatcher
fsz_mb = os.stat(source).st_size / units.Mi
2015-11-09 07:57:04.777 26189 ERROR oslo_messaging.rpc.dispatcher
OSError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory:
'sheepdog:10.133.17.61:7000:volume-a0a70f9b-a50e-4369-885f-c41a894c9fe5'
'''
The reason is that in some cluster storage systems, like
ceph/sheepdog, QEMU can access an image directly via their private
protocol, and theres no need to map an image as a block device on
the host. In this case, the qemu-img convert command may like
'qemu-img convert -O raw sheepdog:Ip:port:image_name temp_file' or
'qemu-img convert -O raw rbd:pool_name/image_name temp_file'. So
when it run the os.stat(source) method, the source path may be
'sheepdog:Ip:port:image_name' or 'rbd:pool_name/image_name', then
an OSError is raised.
In this case, the source path is not in OS, we can use the dest
path instead to resolve the problem.

Change-Id: I5fd1e51840972a67053b85a76f8e001fa8148ad7
Closes-Bug: #1514442
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-09 15:32:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'fix the bug of OSError when copy volume to image

when it run the os.stat(source) method, the source path may be
'sheepdog:Ip:port:image_name' or 'rbd:pool_name/image_name', then
an OSError is raised.
In this case, the source path is not in OS, we can use the dest
path instead to resolve the problem.

Change-Id: I5fd1e51840972a67053b85a76f8e001fa8148ad7
Closes-Bug: #1514442

', 'number': 8}, {'created': '2015-11-13 15:05:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix the bug of OSError when convert image

When I try to convert a image use image_utils.convert_image() method,
an error occurred like this :
'''
OSError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory:
'sheepdog:10.133.17.61:7000:volume-a0a70f9b-a50e-4369-885f-c41a894c9fe5'
'''
The reason is that in some cluster storage systems, like
ceph/sheepdog, QEMU can access an image directly via their private
protocol, and theres no need to map an image as a block device on
the host. In this case, the qemu-img convert command may like:

    #qemu-img convert -O raw sheepdog:Ip:port:image_name temp_file
    #qemu-img convert -O raw rbd:pool_name/image_name temp_file

The source path may be 'sheepdog:Ip:port:image_name' or
'rbd:pool_name/image_name', it doesn't exist in OS. So, when it runs
the os.stat(source) in image_utils.convert_image(source,dest,out_format)
method, an OSError would be raised.

We can use qemu_img_info method instead to resolve this problem, because
the 'qemu-img info' command can always get the image size info which has
support qemu-img tool. Here we capture a ValueError just in case, but it
only need to give a warning message, because the image has been successfully
converted.

Change-Id: I5fd1e51840972a67053b85a76f8e001fa8148ad7
Closes-Bug: #1514442

commit_message:
Fix the bug of OSError when convert image

When I try to convert a image use image_utils.convert_image() method,
an error occurred like this :
'''
OSError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory:
'sheepdog:10.133.17.61:7000:volume-a0a70f9b-a50e-4369-885f-c41a894c9fe5'
'''
The reason is that in some cluster storage systems, like
ceph/sheepdog, QEMU can access an image directly via their private
protocol, and theres no need to map an image as a block device on
the host. In this case, the qemu-img convert command may like:

    #qemu-img convert -O raw sheepdog:Ip:port:image_name temp_file
    #qemu-img convert -O raw rbd:pool_name/image_name temp_file

The source path may be 'sheepdog:Ip:port:image_name' or
'rbd:pool_name/image_name', it doesn't exist in OS. So, when it runs
the os.stat(source) in image_utils.convert_image(source,dest,out_format)
method, an OSError would be raised.

We can use qemu_img_info method instead to resolve this problem, because
the 'qemu-img info' command can always get the image size info which has
support qemu-img tool. Here we capture a ValueError just in case, but it
only need to give a warning message, because the image has been successfully
converted.

Change-Id: I5fd1e51840972a67053b85a76f8e001fa8148ad7
Closes-Bug: #1514442

[{'created': '2015-11-16 11:43:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix PATH variable for Ubuntu based bootstrap

CentOS 7 has $PATH variable which is different from Ubuntu one. In particular,
CentOS does not export /sbin or /bin. This leads to inability to find basic
commands like rm, ln or MAKEDEV (even though they are present in environment)
when executing simple chroot() from CentOS to Ubuntu-based environment.

commit_message:
Fix PATH variable for Ubuntu based bootstrap

CentOS 7 has $PATH variable which is different from Ubuntu one.
In particular, CentOS does not export /sbin or /bin. This leads
to inability to find basic commands like rm, ln or MAKEDEV
(even though they are present in environment) when executing
simple chroot() from CentOS to Ubuntu-based environment.

Blueprint: master-on-centos7

Compatible with CentOS6 master node

Change-Id: I2ce18598bcd84a328b149a135ed8579ffb8b5200

commit_message:
net-bgpvpn: Make requirements check non-voting

Until we make a first release, our current master targets stable/liberty.
Currently, the check-requirements jobs currently prevent us from updating
our *requirements.txt file with liberty-compatible versions.

We also plan to have backport branches for kilo and juno, but if
check-requirements jobs have no way to determine that these branches
ought to be tested against the stable/kilo and stable/juno requirements,
we expect the same issue.

This change makes check-requirements non-voting.

Change-Id: I21c8aadd82249882243bf8e23b37e23fcb62f507

subject: Check response headers for microversions
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-23 13:21:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Check response headers for microversions

novaclient provides version negotiation on CLI layer. In case of usage
novaclient as a lib, user can specify api_version with microversion part
and can try communicate with Nova endpoint which doesn't support
microversions. Nova endpoint will not check X-OpenStack-Nova-API-Version
header and will execute request(it can be correct or not). It this case
we should warn user about his mistake and about "incorrect" response.

Change-Id: I7a5ab964b7b2b2a49cc80c22bf67ad5548afb30b
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-23 16:01:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Check response headers for microversions

novaclient provides version negotiation on CLI layer. In case of usage

and can try communicate with Nova endpoint which doesn't support

commit_message:
Check response headers for microversions

novaclient provides version negotiation on CLI layer. In case of usage
novaclient as a lib, user can specify api_version with microversion part
and can try communicate with Nova endpoint which doesn't support
microversions. Nova endpoint will not check X-OpenStack-Nova-API-Version
header and will execute request(it can be correct or not). It this case
we should warn user about his mistake and about "incorrect" response.

Change-Id: I7a5ab964b7b2b2a49cc80c22bf67ad5548afb30b

commit_message:
Rename default config

The default config file for searchlight is searchlight-api.conf despite
the fact it's used by the listener as well. It makes more sense to
rename the default to searchlight.conf.

Change-Id: I91744f02a27faa00f5ce082557cf78bf911fb085
Closes-bug: #1515015

subject: Add ipaddress to global-requirements.txt
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-25 12:36:18.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Add ipaddress to global-requirements.txt

Port of the 3.3+ ipaddress module to 2.6, 2.7, 3.2

- Is the library actively maintained?

  Yes. See the recent commit history at:
  https://github.com/phihag/ipaddress/commits/master

- Is the library good code?

  Yes, given it's a port of a Python 3.3 module.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes.

- Is the library license compatible?

  The license is Python Software Foundation License Version 2:
  https://github.com/phihag/ipaddress/blob/master/LICENSE

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  Yes, it's packaged for Ubuntu, Fedora, CentOS.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

  Not that I'm aware of.

Change-Id: Ic4ba8e767369a68f1ac9379dc71ec01b2967c6ce
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add ipaddress to global-requirements.txt

Port of the 3.3+ ipaddress module to 2.6, 2.7, 3.2

- Is the library actively maintained?

  Yes. See the recent commit history at:
  https://github.com/phihag/ipaddress/commits/master

- Is the library good code?

  Yes, given it's a port of a Python 3.3 module.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes.

- Is the library license compatible?

  The license is Python Software Foundation License Version 2:
  https://github.com/phihag/ipaddress/blob/master/LICENSE

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  Yes, it's packaged for Ubuntu, Fedora, CentOS.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

  Not that I'm aware of.

Change-Id: Ic4ba8e767369a68f1ac9379dc71ec01b2967c6ce

commit_message:
Skip package section from input parameters

Sometimes package section can be provided with input parameters from
Cloud Foundry. We need to skip it to prevent various errors.

Closes-Bug: #1517035

commit_message:
Don't build two tox envs for pep8(-constraints)

Currently, "tox -e pep8" builds two tox envs:
a "pep8" env, and then a "venv" env for genopts.

This is rather wasteful -- reuse the pep8 env
instead.

Change-Id: I8ba3d4e541f279e5bc62dba2b1caaac447fee7e3

commit_message:
Add check-requirements for cliff

cliff had made requirements check in
I40b2cf4030df66c851d7d11da4f81f645d110e76 and it was not enabled again.

Remove non-voting and make it voting in the gate as well - with using
the check-requirements template.

Note that cliff is in the global requirments sync, thus it should have a
gate job as explained in
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/requirements/#enforcement-in-projects

Change-Id: I4f22c58e469d42b64694123b13c64fe620bae1eb

subject: Add "httpchk /versions" for glance-api haproxy.
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-23 13:11:55.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/vars/configs/haproxy_config.yml'], 'message': 'Add "httpchk /versions" for glance-api haproxy.

With the default httpchk, glance-api always show warning in the logs
"WARNING glance.api.middleware.version_negotiation [..] Unknown version.
Returning version choices", with the /versions added, there is no
warning in the log.

Change-Id: I086cb23c30b9e3ddc5eac68cba42d03ed907138c
(cherry picked from commit 2a2da2f5aa271eebb06016060c62eee4618a0228)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add "httpchk /versions" for glance-api haproxy.

With the default httpchk, glance-api always show warning in the logs
"WARNING glance.api.middleware.version_negotiation [..] Unknown version.
Returning version choices", with the /versions added, there is no
warning in the log.

Change-Id: I086cb23c30b9e3ddc5eac68cba42d03ed907138c
(cherry picked from commit 2a2da2f5aa271eebb06016060c62eee4618a0228)

commit_message:
[config-ref] Dummy include of conf-change tables

This patch includes most of the conf-changes tables in chapters to make
the build work without too much tweaks in conf.py.

Also manually fix a broken cinder table.

Change-Id: I9f77926bcd1f9688ae877951bd969ac5fcd29b61
Implements: blueprint config-ref-rst

commit_message:
Update juno for new dev work - 20 Nov 2015

Updates all repo SHAs to open up work on 10.1.18

The SHA's included in this patch are very likely to be the final SHA's
for Juno as the EOL for Juno in OpenStack is scheduled for today.

Closes-Bug: #1515001
Change-Id: Ieac6696abca78daa2b1fa377a680a86fff9a1d24

commit_message:
Add support of extend_kopts for ubuntu_bootstrap

This commit adds posibility to use different kernel boot options
if user would like to modify it. The extend_kopts.rb takes two strings,
compares them and modifies default kopts.

Implements: Blueprint modify-fuel-library
Change-Id: Iac69c8457bd0ce76a1082c98d679ff44f468bf1f

commit_message:
Modifying docimpact group

Modfying the default docimpact group for all projects (except Nova, Swift,
Glance, Keystone, and Cinder) to raise bugs in their own projects, rather
than openstack-manuals.

Change-Id: Ide50b2fcbb070943d2b7efed728c40383a05aed9
Implements-blueprint: review-docimpact

commit_message:
[zmq] Use PortOpt config option for ports

Use PortOpt instead of IntOpt for port-range restriction
options (rpc_zmq_min_port, rpc_zmq_max_port) and other
port-related options.

Change-Id: I7442de45e57713cdfa332cd897a07fb11926ca49
Closes-Bug: #1518256

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-24 06:24:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[docs] Update error message

Error message changed when Update environment returns HTTP 400
at commit ac2b523302604abca83212233d5d68ea43651877.

before: Environment name must contain only alphanumeric or "_-."
        characters, must start with alpha
after : Environment name must contain at least one non-white
        space symbol

This patch fixes it in the doc.

Change-Id: I9bba2cb92cf8d034c54a6209a8ba60b3075b15db
Closes-Bug: #1519217
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-24 23:56:11.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/specification/murano-api.rst'], 'message': '[docs] Update error message

Error message changed when Update environment returns HTTP 400
at commit ac2b523302604abca83212233d5d68ea43651877.

before: Environment name must contain only alphanumeric or "_-."
        characters, must start with alpha
after : Environment name must contain at least one non-white
        space symbol

This patch fixes it in the doc.

Change-Id: I9bba2cb92cf8d034c54a6209a8ba60b3075b15db
Closes-Bug: #1519217
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
[docs] Update error message

Error message changed when Update environment returns HTTP 400
at commit ac2b523302604abca83212233d5d68ea43651877.

before: Environment name must contain only alphanumeric or "_-."
        characters, must start with alpha
after : Environment name must contain at least one non-white
        space symbol

This patch fixes it in the doc.

Change-Id: I9bba2cb92cf8d034c54a6209a8ba60b3075b15db
Closes-Bug: #1519217

commit_message:
cells: skip 5 networking scenario tests that use floating IPs

These scenario tests run with neutron and rely on assigning floating IPs
which cells v1 doesn't support, so skip them.

Longer term I think we'll have a feature toggle in Tempest to allow
disabling these tests via config but this is quicker and easier for now
to get a cells v1 + neutron job in the experimental queue.

Change-Id: Ieb3b117449f56810f1a41fcf43e737ae919b8945

commit_message:
Bug fix while editing actions with missing keys

If a key is not present in the database, the panel failed to open the modal
windows for edition, this fix that by using the dict.get()

cherry-picked from: b08558eba43dfc45335ad817de327048ad76cf64

Change-Id: Ic5f5e216828f10d41f288408fc5109dc004c6ab9

commit_message:
Freezer Scheduler for Windows

Freezer now has support for scheduling jobs through windows service.

This windows service needs to be installed in user land rather than
service land, instructions are included in the README.rst

--no-api mode is not available on windows

Change-Id: I34db28ffc928703b01e6430a661214d66d81c518

commit_message:
Disable mistral-python34 in all branches except mitaka and higher

Support of python34 was implemented only in mitaka, so it was
incorrect to make this gate voting in all branches because now
merge patches in old stable branches is blocked.

Change-Id: I8772b59bd3b318f3c1caec6cc8a27a33af6bbf87

commit_message:
Add guidelines for release notes to devref

Starting from this cycle (and stable Liberty) we're using reno for
release notes. This commit adds guidelines on when a release note is
required to be added.

commit_message:
Change cluster to cluster_id in nodegroup

Introduced by change-id: I413f77ce1dca59ae2c48ba743513ddf5584713e8
Nodegroup 'cluster' field has been changed to 'cluster_id' in
nailgun. So we need to adjust fuelclient accordingly.

Also includes some changes in nodegroups unit tests.

Change-Id: Iba3df02142279c14910578770187ac93157190c4
Closes-bug: #1518341

commit_message:
Implement Gnocchi Statsd support

* Manage Gnocchi statsd package & service
* Manage Gnocchi configuration
* Complete example manifests and acceptance tests with the new class.
* Make sure db_sync is run before gnocchi services, otherwise statsd
  would fail to start.

Change-Id: Ib894571889a69e67760402217f9fc18a339ced19

commit_message:
Add display_name to Quobyte backend volume name

Improves readability in Quobyte volume names by
using display_name and id to build the backend volume name.
The share display name is preserved to keep volume names easily
identifyable in the backend.
Adding the share id ensures uniqueness of
Quobyte backend volume names.

Implements: blueprint display-name-in-quobyte-backend

Change-Id: Ie7ffd3d45aa258bde3845547055ff3e85fffb8db

commit_message:
Add test with removing multirack cluster

* Remove deployed environment
* Check that nodes from custom nodegroup have 'ERROR' status after discovering
* Reset slaves from custom nodegroup and make sure they aren't discovered again

Change-Id: I9ae3a81a0125cfed9c8f9b9cfd971ebbec640428
Implements: blueprint test-custom-nodegroup-controllers

subject: Move Calico's mechanism driver to networking-calico
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-16 16:17:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Move Calico's mechanism driver to networking-calico

The Calico mechanism driver was previously part of
https://github.com/projectcalico/calico, but logically belongs in
networking-calico - the OpenStack/Neutron integration code for Calico
- and so is now moving to this repository.  As well as the mechanism
driver code, this move includes:

- unit testing for the mechanism driver

- creation of a neutron.ml2.mechanism_drivers entry point for the name
  'calico'

- requirements updates as needed for the new code.

Also, so that Calico's Debian and RPM package-based installations
continue to work, and so that existing installations can be smoothly
upgraded, this change adds Debian and RPM packaging to
networking-calico.  Established Calico installation instructions [1,2]
use the umbrella package names 'calico-control' and 'calico-compute'
to indicate whatever is needed to add Calico function to an OpenStack
controller and compute node respectively, and (as these are
OpenStack-specific concepts) responsibility for generating these
umbrella packages also now moves from
https://github.com/projectcalico/calico to networking-calico.

calico-control and calico-compute both depend on a third package,
'networking-calico', which is the package that contains
networking-calico's Python code.  Thus an install of the
'networking-calico' Debian or RPM package should be very similar to a
'pip install networking-calico' from PyPI.

[1] http://docs.projectcalico.org/en/latest/ubuntu-opens-install.html
[2] http://docs.projectcalico.org/en/latest/redhat-opens-install.html

commit_message:
Move Calico's mechanism driver to networking-calico

The Calico mechanism driver was previously part of
https://github.com/projectcalico/calico, but logically belongs in
networking-calico - the OpenStack/Neutron integration code for Calico
- and so is now moving to this repository.  As well as the mechanism
driver code, this move includes:

- unit testing for the mechanism driver

- creation of a neutron.ml2.mechanism_drivers entry point for the name
  'calico'

- requirements updates as needed for the new code.

Also, so that Calico's Debian and RPM package-based installations
continue to work, and so that existing installations can be smoothly
upgraded, this change adds Debian and RPM packaging to
networking-calico.  Established Calico installation instructions [1,2]
use the umbrella package names 'calico-control' and 'calico-compute'
to indicate whatever is needed to add Calico function to an OpenStack
controller and compute node respectively, and (as these are
OpenStack-specific concepts) responsibility for generating these
umbrella packages also now moves from
https://github.com/projectcalico/calico to networking-calico.

calico-control and calico-compute both depend on a third package,
'networking-calico', which is the package that contains
networking-calico's Python code.  Thus an install of the
'networking-calico' Debian or RPM package should be very similar to a
'pip install networking-calico' from PyPI.

[1] http://docs.projectcalico.org/en/latest/ubuntu-opens-install.html
[2] http://docs.projectcalico.org/en/latest/redhat-opens-install.html

Change-Id: I54724a4e4fbb465daddcff07e6da19cb91b2dc4a

commit_message:
Freescale ML2 driver code complete decomposition.

This removes all the artifacts specific to Freescale ML2 driver code
from the Neutron tree. The code is maintained at github repository.

Change-Id: I194a4da49058724766b7fde7343f85d19a75fe8c
Closes-Bug: #1519078

commit_message:
Fix two errors in setup_training_guides

setup_training_guides was written assuming that the project would be
passed as the first argument, but it wasn't called like that. Change
the function to match others to hardcode the project, and look for the
version as the first argument.

Correct the path to the locale directory so that the Zanata client can
read and write translation files correctly.

Change-Id: Iacfd2e831d18af5870fc70a2a54e569d0924474e

commit_message:
Skip cinder tests if cinder is not available

Currently, cinder tests run even when the cinder service is not
available and fails. This commit skips the tests if the cinder
service is not available.

This patch also updates readme on using tox to run tempest tests.

Change-Id: Idd607012346004b39c9d4cbe752b0cdcfe3e3311

commit_message:
New operation env-template-create-env

After create a new template you need to create the environment from template.
You need a operation for this action. This is the new operation.

Implements blueprint: template-create-environment

Change-Id: If9d8df008a167a371af38d758ecf356e14b8510d

commit_message:
Add related parameters to designate::central

This patch is aim to add the following params in to designate::central
  - workers
  - threads
  - max_domain_name_len
  - max_recordset_name_len
  - min_ttl
  - default_pool_id

Change-Id: I00a9bb85675983d0ba0f58ef0fa58fd504b11095
closes-Bug: #1482004
